title: Certified upcycled foods continue to gain traction with the category projected to reach $80b by 2032 - FoodNavigator-USA.com
summary: The Upcycled Trade Association has experienced significant growth in the number of associated companies and certified products, with an expected $80 billion market by 2032. The association focuses on defining and certifying upcycled food to avoid greenwashing and provide transparency to consumers, aiming to educate and reassure consumers for long-term growth.
green_innovation: TRUE, This initiative qualifies as a green innovation as it involves creating a system that redirects food ingredients from being wasted to being used for human consumption through a verified supply chain, promoting environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE, The establishment and growth of the Upcycled Trade Association, along with the development of a clear definition and certification program for upcycled food products, represent a business innovation in the food industry.
green_product: TRUE, The article mentions upcycled food as a green product, as it involves the design and production of food products in a way that significantly reduces environmental impact throughout the product lifecycle. It focuses on using ingredients that would have otherwise gone to waste, thereby promoting sustainability.
green_process: TRUE, The process of upcycling food to redirect ingredients that would have been wasted for human consumption through a verified supply chain is considered a green process. This method minimizes environmental impacts and supports sustainability by reducing waste and promoting ecological benefits.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 813910 - Business Associations, 424490 - Other Grocery and Related Products Merchant Wholesalers, 115310 - Support Activities for Forestry, 441310 - Automotive Parts and Accessories Stores
greenwashing: FALSE, The article emphasizes the efforts made by the Upcycled Trade Association to define and certify upcycled food products clearly, provide transparency to consumers, and avoid greenwashing tactics.

title: Upcycled flour replacement introduced at IFT FIRST - BakingBusiness.com
summary: Renewal Mill debuted a 100% upcycled flour replacement blend at the IFT FIRST event in Chicago, offering a versatile alternative to conventional flours with more fiber and protein content for various applications.
green_innovation: TRUE - The RenewALL 100% Upcycled Blend introduced by Renewal Mill aligns with green innovation by promoting sustainability through upcycling and reducing environmental impact in the food industry.
business_innovation: TRUE - The development of the RenewALL 100% Upcycled Blend by Renewal Mill qualifies as a business innovation as it represents a new product offering that differs significantly from traditional flour products in the market.
green_product: TRUE - The RenewALL 100% Upcycled Blend by Renewal Mill meets the criteria of a green product by being designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle, offering a sustainable flour replacement option.
green_process: TRUE - The production process of the RenewALL 100% Upcycled Blend aligns with green process practices by upcycling ingredients and minimizing waste, thus promoting sustainability and reducing environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311211 - Flour Milling, 311999 - All Other Miscellaneous Food Manufacturing, 325314 - Fertilizer (Mixing Only) Manufacturing, 551112 - Offices of Other Holding Companies
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it truthfully presents the innovation of the RenewALL 100% Upcycled Blend by Renewal Mill without deceptive environmental claims.
